name: B&B Belgravia

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Based on other TripAdvisor user reviews, we stayed at this very fine B&B for 3 nights in early December. We were not disappointed. It is less than a 10 minute walk from Victoria Station. Several restaurants are "around the corner." There are rooms on 3 or 4 floors (no elevator). We asked for a room in the back and on the 1st floor (that's one flight up in American terms). Our room was as expected; clean and comfortable, though not very large - typical of Europe. The bathroom was bright and modern. There was a very good cooked to order English breakfast. The staff were kind, efficient and helpful. Tea and coffee were always available in the lounge as was free use of a computer/internet. There are any number of places to stay along this section of Ebury Street - this is the best of the three we have tried in recent years. Only downside is the price of over $200 a night, but this is London and like anywhere, you get what you pay for.
reviews.title: An excellent spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Like so many other posters on this site, my wife and I (both in our forties) really liked the place. A good location in a quiet street close to Victoria station; a decent sized room (for London), with a good bath and a surprisingly comfortable bed; and a great breakfast! Only downside for me was the climb to the top floor where our room (room 11) was; more than 50 stairs spread over 6 flights, and a steep climb at that. We had travelled light, and only stayed two nights; if we'd been visiting for a week or more, and had more luggage with us, the climb would have been somewhat challenging. That's the only downside to what otherwise was a really great place to stay, and the place deserves its good ranking on this site.
reviews.title: Great place to stay; but watch the climb

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the B&B Belgravia for 2 weekend nights in September. Overall a pleasant stay – many very good things to say about the b&b but unfortunately there was one very big minus: the noise carrying into the room as soon as breakfast started.
reviews.title: Modern, charming b&b

likes.disliked: — lack of solitude due to noise from breakfast room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple

reviews.text: Room was wonderful and large by London standards. The only minuses: When we first arrived at 3pm, no one would answer the door. It was raining and we had a lot of luggage so the extra 15 minutes in the cold put us in a foul mood.

reviews.title: Caution. Do not confuse this with 118 Ebury St

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This may be the best hotel value in London. Friendly and attentive service, great breakfast, fresh towels every day, bed made every day, clean, public PC, quiet, TV, and convenient. Each room has a phone but you will need a calling card to dial out.
reviews.title: Quality Continues

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Great find in London. Positives are room size, the breakfast and the help yourself coffee bar. Only negative the street facing rooms are noisy. Definitely going back. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Great London value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I had a great stay at the B+B Belgravia during our recent trip to London. The entire hotel was very clean and all of the staff members we dealt with were extremely friendly and helpful. We stayed for three nights in a nice double room. The room was small, but had room for luggage for two people. We had a nice private bathroom. The hotel was very modern, with a nice lounge area with free internet access, coffee, tea, biscuits, etc. The breakfast was great each morning, too!
reviews.title: Perfect B+B in London!

likes.disliked: — No window in room, only door!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006
reviews.text: The location was very convenient, with a quick walk to Victoria Station and the Underground. It was a great hotel and I would definately reccommend.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the B&B Belgravia four nights while touring the U.K.. As others have stated, it is within walking distance to Victoria Station, Buckingham Palace, Harrods, and other tourist sights. Just be sure to wear comfortable shoes. The modern lobby with the coffee/tea/espresso machine was warm and inviting. Each day I would take a few moments to check emails on the computer in the lobby while eating a wonderful shorbread cookie and sipping an espresso; quite a treat after walking all day. The breakfast served in the cheery breakfast area was very filling and served promptly. The rooms, although small, were well appointed, and the shower had plenty of hot water. I loved the modern sink. We were given fresh towels daily, and the room was made up each day. The staff was wonderful, especially the little gal from Hungary.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: My wife and I needed somewhere to stay near the Royal Albert Hall for one night and chose B+B Belgravia after seeing a review in a magazine. We thought it was great, quirky and friendly. The room was spotless and the bathroom small but adequate. Yes, there are drawbacks, the front door is permanently locked (they give you a daily code), it does not have air conditioning (but they do supply fans) and it does not have any lifts (we were on the top floor but, thankfully, very fit), but for £99 per night it was good value. We recently stayed at a hotel in Covent Garden paying over £300 per night and whilst it was a fantastic place, it was not as good value for money, a critisism that you cannot direct at Belgravia B+B. Would we stay there again? yes, for sure. Would we recommend it? yes, just don't expect any frills.
reviews.title: Great value, great location, great hotel

likes.disliked: — No printer available, so you can check in on line but cannot print boarding pass

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: The B&B Belgravia is a wonderful, clean, modern looking hotel with the warmth and service of an old fashioned B and B. We stayed three nights and found the location perfect, close to the tube. All of the staff was very welcoming and tried very hard to please. One staff member spent almost an hour on her personal laptop trying to assist us when we had a problem with the British Airway site. The hotel is very clean and our rooms were great. We had a room at the very top, so it was a bit of a climb with the suitcase, but it looked out over the trees and gardens in the back and had a lovely bathroom with a large tub. There was a fan in each room, which kept the room cool and a large window. The breakfast was very nice with many selections...the usual eggs, sausage, etc, plus fresh baked goods, toast, yogurt, jams, cereals, fresh fruit and some really good cheeses. The 24 coffee and tea machine was a great added touch. I hope to go be able to go back soon.
reviews.title: An absolute joke!

likes.disliked: — Room the size of a treehouse

description: This award-winning boutique B&B offers 17 en-suite rooms in exclusive Belgravia. The original grade II listed building has been sympathetically maintained and the interior design offers modern, contemporary and stylish accommodation. Extras include a guest lounge with free use of the laptop, free Wi-Fi access, complimentary teas & coffees 24/7, daily newspapers and bike hire. Design, service, quality and comfort are all part of the philosophy. To quote a regular Scandinavian guest: "Sophisticated simplicity!"
